text: I think the hardest thing about making music now is being a great dad at the same time. There's an insanity that goes with writing - a mad scientist thing that you have to go through - and sacrificing a kid's upbringing to do that is not an option.
author: Eddie Vedder

text: I'm not an American, but I have this weird connection to America in different ways through my dad living here for five years, my godfather being an American who I'm very close to.
author: Damian Lewis

text: I spent a lot of time on farms when I was young. My uncle and my dad owned a big farm.
author: Emeril Lagasse

text: My dad was an engineer and so I had this picture of science and technology and pursuits of the mind as being more impressive than artistic pursuits, which I saw a as kind of frivolous.
author: Scott McCloud

text: I hate being clean-shaven. My daughter gets very upset if I shave and says, 'Bring back the spikes, Dad.'
author: Eric Bana

text: I have this complex. I don't like too much exposure. I don't know why it is. Maybe it's bred in me, because my dad always told me to be humble and don't think you're too good.
author: Mark Viduka

text: Comedy was why I got into acting the first place. Peter Sellers was a huge influence on my wanting to act. I grew up with him and found him hysterical. The Pink Panther films were an inspiration, from my earliest childhood days, when I was watching them with my brother and my dad.
author: Sally Hawkins

text: What is a normal childhood? We weren't rich, we were pretty middle-class. My dad survived from job to job with him taking care of so many relatives, he couldn't save any money.
author: Charlie Sheen

text: We had our first earthquake over here recently. That was a bizarre feeling. I just became disoriented and I remember my dad freaking out. Nothing broke or anything.
author: Ashley Scott

text: Overcoming my dad telling me that I could never amount to anything is what has made me the megalomaniac that you see today.
author: Bono

text: I kept my babies fed. I could have dumped them, but I didn't. I decided that whatever trip I was on, they were going with me. You're looking at a real daddy.
author: Barry White

text: As a brother and sister, our tastes were pretty different growing up. He liked a lot of early hip hop. My dad didn't understand it and would try to talk him out of it.
author: Taryn Manning

text: It's always been a dream of mine to get somewhere and to have my mom and dad with me up there.
author: Haley Reinhart

text: I'm concerned a little bit with the culture of celebrating the fundraise. My dad taught me that when you borrow money it's the worst day of your life.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

text: My dad dragged me to a Bruce Springsteen concert as a kid. It was my first concert, but I fell asleep in the middle. My second concert was Weezer on the 'Pinkerton' tour, and 'Pinkerton' is the reason why I'm doing this.
author: Nate Ruess

text: My dad's a scratch golfer and I've got the knack of seeing something and then replicating it. I saw my dad swing a club and I worked out how to do the same thing. My backswing and follow-through have been basically the same since I was two.
author: Rory McIlroy

text: I have never been a material girl. My father always told me never to love anything that cannot love you back.
author: Imelda Marcos

text: My dad was good friends with the Bad Medicine Blues Band - one of the only blues bands in Fargo, as you can imagine! He took me out to see them play when I was 12 years old and I was really inspired by their guitar player, Ted Larsen.
author: Jonny Lang

text: Employee fathers need to step up to the plate and put their family needs on the table.
author: James Levine

text: I mean, my dad's a television producer, and I knew I could get a job as an assistant or a reader with one of his friends, but it wasn't exactly what I wanted to do.
author: J. J. Abrams

text: I had never said, 'dad, I love you.'
author: Michael Reagan

text: My mother is Italian and my dad's Irish. In my family, we're expressive. Nobody holds back.
author: Kate Walsh

text: My memories are of my dad taking me to football on Saturday mornings, and my mum taking me swimming. Those are the things I remember from my childhood, not sitting around the table debating capitalism and the profit squeeze.
author: David Miliband

text: I was recording stuff with my dad when I was like five, six years old. I played with him on tour. I'd gone with him to Japan in '91, played some gigs, did a couple shows at the Albert Hall.
author: Dhani Harrison

text: In my case, I was born to parents who were very young, and I don't think they were entirely ready to have a child. My dad was going to college and working two or three jobs at the same time, and my mum was working and going to school.
author: Gillian Anderson

text: My dad is a Deadhead, my mom's a Jewish-American princess from Jersey.
author: Adam Lambert

text: I feel that marrying younger and being quite a young dad helped me with the stability of my career.
author: Patrick Duffy

text: My grandmother was an actress too. In the thirties and forties she was under contract with Universal Studios. Crazy credits, lots of them. My dad was also under contract with Universal Studios. And my first film was shot on the same stage they both worked on at Universal.
author: Chris Pine

text: My dad, Donald, was a vet and had a practice in Yorkshire. Cats and dogs were his bread and butter, but his greatest love was large animals.
author: Alastair Campbell

text: I would say the most help I got was from my dad. My dad is a civil engineer in Switzerland he's 90 years old now, so he's no longer active as a civil engineer, but still a very active person.
author: Claude Nicollier

text: My dad was this sort of avant-garde guy who did all kinds of weird things. He was a true original and anybody who met him never forgot him.
author: Paul Thomas Anderson

text: My mom's been married three times my dad has been married a lot. I didn't really see my dad that much.
author: Skeet Ulrich

text: My dad saw my husband's boss at a conference, and he said to stop paying my husband until we produce children.
author: Jenna Bush

text: My dad knows the business, and he tells me I've got to do what's best for me.
author: Jamie Redknapp

text: I've got a really great family round me, two sisters and an older brother and my mum and dad. Everybody's equal.
author: Nicholas Hoult

text: My dad always said he couldn't remember a time when I did not want to act.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

text: We all have roles in life. I'm a dad, a husband, this and that, but basically I only feel justified in being alive when I'm on the stage.
author: Jack Bruce

text: I had my footballing heroes such as Bryan Robson and Diego Maradona but my dad was a rugby league star, and he was my real hero. But the relationship with my mum was rocky and we saw things that would affect any youngster.
author: Ryan Giggs

text: My dad doesn't like religion much, but I grew up very close to the Baptist tradition. God isn't this distant thing. God is right here with you all the time. He's your buddy, and you can talk about everything.
author: Lucy Alibar

text: So I was always around music and my dad was in his own way a progressive jazzer, a big band jazzer guy.
author: Billy Sherwood

text: That is the thankless position of the father in the family - the provider for all, and the enemy of all.
author: August Strindberg

text: My dad has more sparkly stuff than most men.
author: Georgia Jagger

text: I'm turning into a stricter dad.
author: David Duchovny

text: I wasn't sure how my dad would react. There was an agent sitting behind them and he told me he was embarrassed to watch the scenes. My parents have always been very open. They trust my decisions.
author: Shannon Elizabeth

text: Work ethic has always been stressed in my family. My dad is going to be 80 years old and he still works part time. My mom just retired a couple years ago and she's in her mid- to late 70s.
author: Jamie Moyer

text: I'm not sure what the future holds but I do know that I'm going to be positive and not wake up feeling desperate. As my dad said 'Nic, it is what it is, it's not what it should have been, not what it could have been, it is what it is.'
author: Nicole Kidman

text: Things with my dad were pretty good until I won an Academy Award. He was really loving to me until I got more attention than he did. Then he hated me.
author: Tatum O'Neal

text: I know who my dad is, I've met him a few times, but I don't even call him dad. I know it sounds horrible, but I don't even see him as part of my family, to be honest. If you want the truth, it doesn't bother me because I don't know any different. I just know that me and my mum, that was my family.
author: Sally Pearson

text: As it has been told to me, my Dad had some kind of deal with Dick Clark. But when we got here, that fell through. So we were out here with no job, no furniture, no food.
author: Danny Bonaduce

text: I've always wanted to be a dad.
author: Kris Allen

text: I couldn't walk down any street in Britain without being laughed at. It was a nightmare. My children were devastated because their dad was a figure of ridicule.
author: David Icke

text: The time not to become a father is eighteen years before a war.
author: E. B. White

text: To those of you who are wearing ties, I think my dad would appreciate it if you took them off.
author: Robert Moog

text: Aeneas carried his aged father on his back from the ruins of Troy and so do we all, whether we like it or not, perhaps even if we have never known them.
author: Angela Carter

text: Whoever does not have a good father should procure one.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Yeah, my dad bought me a guitar when I was like 10, and I didn't really want it then.
author: Miranda Lambert

text: I think he would have been proud and smiling... when we laid him to rest because his family was together. I think that was a great gift to be able to give Dad at the end.
author: Michael Reagan

text: My dad keeps joking about sneaking into my grandparents' house and switching out their HBO for PBS so they think I'm on 'Downton Abbey.'
author: Allison Williams

text: When I was a kid, I wanted to walk with my dad's limp - my dad was my hero - but that infuriated him, and he would make me walk back and forth in the living room until I walked without it.
author: David Alan Grier

text: Growing up, I didn't give my grandfather's photography a second thought. I wasn't involved in his work, except that I helped my dad print his negatives.
author: Kim Weston

text: As I get older and I get a few more years experience I become more like Dad, you know, King Lear.
author: David Crystal

text: I grew up in a big Irish, Catholic family. My dad was a pretty rough guy. So one of my brothers left home when he was 15 and found his way to the gym. It gave me the opportunity to go and spend some time with him and work out in the gym.
author: Gerry Cooney

text: I love playing a dad. It's hard to find family dramas that are genuinely funny.
author: Peter Gallagher

text: My dad always said, 'Champ, the measure of a man is not how often he is knocked down, but how quickly he gets up.'
author: Joe Biden

text: Dad was just an emotional wreck. He was drinking a lot of the time, he was smoking a lot of pot. And because he takes certain medications, the drinking was making him... you know, he wasn't even present, really.
author: Jack Osbourne

text: 'Nil By Mouth' was a bit autobiographical, but as I always pointed out at the time, that's not my dad.
author: Gary Oldman

text: A mustache really defines your face. My dad had a mustache when I was growing up, and I can still remember when he shaved it, he looked like a completely different person.
author: Jason Sudeikis

text: I have always thought of Walt Disney as my second father.
author: Annette Funicello

text: My father was an Episcopalian minister, and I've always been comforted by the power of prayer.
author: Anna Lee

text: My dad was my first coach and drove me extremely hard from a very young age.
author: Candace Parker

text: My dad had a church of 90 people when I was born. It was just, over the years it continued to grow.
author: Joel Osteen

text: Feels good to try, but playing a father, I'm getting a little older. I see now that I'm taking it more serious and I do want that lifestyle.
author: Adam Sandler

text: As a little girl I used to daydream about my real father coming on a white horse to rescue me.
author: Christine Keeler

text: I had just lost my dad and I remembered all the songs we used to go and hear at concerts, and the records around the house and sometimes we'd play together.
author: Vince Gill

text: My dad was an absentee dad, so it was always important to me that I was part of my daughter's life, and she deserved two parents, which is part of the rationale behind us staying married for 30 years.
author: Samuel L. Jackson

text: I look at my little girl and I wonder what she's going to be and what she's going to do and what is it that leads girls certain directions in life. I think a lot of that goes back to what kind of father they had, and so it makes me want to be the best dad I can possibly be.
author: Jake Owen

text: I always wanted to be a stay-at-home dad making art, making movies.
author: Robert Rodriguez

text: My Dad was so open creatively that I was off in search of black turtleneck bathing suits with long sleeves.
author: Moon Unit Zappa

text: I did Albert Hall, I got to play the Hall of Fame with Prince. So I've done that kind of stuff for ages. It wasn't until after we finished working on Brainwash, my dad's album after he died, then it was like 'That phase is over in my life now, now we can get on with our music, with our band.'
author: Dhani Harrison

text: I wasn't aware of my dad being an actor when I was young. I remember there was an Australian children's entertainer on television called Ralph Harris and when I'd say my father was an actor, kids would say, you know, 'oh, is he Ralph Harris?' And I had to say no and then they would lose interest.
author: Jared Harris

text: It would be nice if I did have a good relationship with my family, and yes, part of me longs to have a mum and dad who love and accept me for who I am. But if they never do, it's OK.
author: Heather Graham

text: I remember once giving my dad some drawings and writings and said, 'If you could just give these to the publisher, that would be great.' And I was about five!
author: Sally Hawkins

text: I've always had an affinity for lawyers. My dad is a lawyer. He's retired now. My brother is a lawyer.
author: Scott Bakula

text: I think that every therapist that I know, including my dad and my sister, have their own issues. But that empathy is what makes them good at their job.
author: Laura Benanti

text: There's sometimes a weird benefit to having an alcoholic, violent father. He really motivated me in that I never wanted to be anything like him.
author: Dean Koontz

text: My dad's sense of humor was direct and sometimes surreal - his quick wit is well known amongst our family and friends. He raised me on Spike Jones records and W.C. Fields movies, and his sense of humor fell somewhere in between.
author: Tony Visconti

text: I'm left handed, but my dad taught me to play guitar right-handed.
author: Dustin Diamond

text: I'm a four star general in this thing, and you don't rise to the ranks of a four star general by hanging about the house being the perfect dad.
author: Sam Elliott

text: I feel very warm towards Mum and Dad for giving us the independence they did. My childhood, and the fact we didn't have a TV, gave me a boundless imagination.
author: Dido Armstrong

text: The best money advice ever given me was from my father. When I was a little girl, he told me, 'Don't spend anything unless you have to.'
author: Dinah Shore

text: I come from an ordinary family - my dad is a carpenter, a roof-maker - and we've always loved racing together.
author: Sebastian Vettel

text: The worst advice I ever received from my dad was to play by the book.
author: Dimebag Darrell

text: But while mum and dad were incredibly caring, it was also a very chaotic household where everyone fought about everything. So I know what it's like to internalize all that chaos.
author: Dave Eggers

text: My Dad, a small-town lawyer, was also named Paul. Until we lost him when I was 16, he was a gentle presence in my life. I like to think he'd be proud of me and my sister and brothers, because I'm sure proud of him and of where I come from, Janesville, Wisconsin.
author: Paul Ryan

text: I've never heard my dad say a bad word about anybody. He always keeps his emotions in check and is a true gentleman. I was taught that losing it was indulgent, a selfish act.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: I've dated all kinds of guys and didn't know who I'd end up with. But I kind of assumed it would be someone more like my dad than not.
author: Miranda Lambert

text: I'm going to take care of the man I'm with. I grew up in a household where my mum takes care of my dad - she cooks, she does everything - and that's the kind of girl I am.
author: Nicole Scherzinger

text: I'm a fun father, but not a good father. The hard decisions always went to my wife.
author: John Lithgow

text: I get that same queasy, nervous, thrilling feeling every time I go to work. That's never worn off since I was 12 years-old with my dad's 8-millimeter movie camera.
author: Steven Spielberg

text: I wasn't anything special as a father. But I loved them and they knew it.
author: Sammy Davis, Jr.

text: I wanted to take up music, so my father bought me a blunt instrument. He told me to knock myself out.
author: Jay London

text: My dad was depressed a lot of the time, and there were a lot of things in his life that he never resolved.
author: Juliana Hatfield

text: I started playing ball when I was a kid. My dad was a pro ball player and he passed on his knowledge to me.
author: Kurt Russell

text: A lot of times I would go into a room and audition for whatever sitcom it was and they would expect me to do sort of what my dad was doing and I am not him so they would be disappointed and I would feel nervous and not know exactly how to do it.
author: Jason Ritter

text: I think when I was a kid, and I was in England and it was all about The Stones, The Who, The Kinks and The Beatles and that's what my dad was into.
author: Slash

text: One of the scary things is that, when you're a kid, you look at your dad as the man who has no fear. When you're an adult, you realize your father had fear, and that you have it, too.
author: David Duchovny

text: I didn't try to copy my dad or fit into the pressure or the mold that everybody tried to make me fit into.
author: Joel Osteen

text: I loved climbing because of the freedom, and having time and space. I remember coming off Everest for the last time, thinking of Dad and wishing that he could have seen what I saw. He would have loved it.
author: Bear Grylls

text: The fundamental defect of fathers, in our competitive society, is that they want their children to be a credit to them.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: My dad has no control over who works with me. Me, me and me alone has to take responsibility for anything.
author: Shane MacGowan

text: And I love Mel Brooks. My Dad loved his movies, too, they're awesome, the kind of thing that if you're in for ten minutes, you're in for two hours.
author: Mike Myers

text: Look, I've got incredible pride for my family. I've absolutely fallen into that cliche of a dad who could just happily talk about my daughter endlessly.
author: Christian Bale

text: I remember my dad working with me on breaking down my script and writing out a back story for my character and all that stuff.
author: Jason Bateman

text: My little son, Atticus, desperately needs his dad and I haven't been there for him... and that's sad.
author: Daniel Baldwin

text: My mum was raised Jewish, my dad is very scientifically minded, and my school was vaguely Christian. We sang hymns in school. I liked the hymns bit, but apart from that, I can take it or leave it. So I had lots of different influences when I was younger.
author: Ben Barnes

text: I love the comic opportunities that come up in the context of a father-son relationship.
author: Harrison Ford

text: My dad was good with actions.
author: William Shatner

text: It was sort of just a family sport. My mom and dad were pretty keen golfers when I was young and so were my grandparents, and I just sort of tagged along with them.
author: Karrie Webb

text: My dad had emphysema and both of my parents had chronic bronchitis and ended up with cancers - all smoking related.
author: Loni Anderson

text: Fathers are biological necessities, but social accidents.
author: Margaret Mead

text: I want my kids to see me as Dad, for God's sake, not a television personality.
author: Gordon Ramsay

text: My dad liked to boil a squirrel head and suck the brains out the nose. Smaller than a chicken, bigger than a rat.
author: Beth Ditto

text: It was, you know, probably 80 degrees out in L.A., and my dad took me outside and there was snow. At the time, I thought, 'Every kid doesn't have snow in their backyard on Christmas?'
author: Tori Spelling

text: I'm the fun dad, I am also the disciplinarian.
author: Johnny Knoxville

text: My dad said to me growing up: 'When all is said and done, if you can count all your true friends on one hand, you're a lucky man.'
author: Josh Charles

text: I just went off for two months traveling around Europe on a motorcycle and pretty much turned my phone off. I did 5,000 miles with my dad. We went through Holland, Germany, Austria, Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia, Montenegro, Italy... and then I did Spain and France by myself.
author: Michael Fassbender

text: Like my dad, I have a Christmas party most years. I like to celebrate and see as many people as possible.
author: Lauren Graham

text: My father was my teacher. But most importantly he was a great dad.
author: Beau Bridges

text: Although my dad was a doctor, we weren't necessarily a super-artsy family. We were just a classic, traditional family who got to take a lot of piano lessons and became a bunch of musicians.
author: Lisa Loeb

text: My dad's got a brilliant eye for scripts 'cos he's a literary agent. He and my agent read a load of scripts and filter them.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

text: My sister is totally my dad's daughter because she loves sports.
author: Ashley Tisdale

text: I'd like to play Matt Damon's daddy. He's a wonderful actor, I really admire him, and I'd like to play his dad one day.
author: Larry Hagman

text: My dad was an editor and a writer, and that's actually what I aspired to be.
author: Anne M. Mulcahy

text: When I was in nursery school, the teachers asked me, y'know, 'What does your dad do for a living?' So I said 'He helps women get pregnant!' They called my mom and they were like, 'What exactly does your husband do?'
author: Natalie Portman

text: You know, I'm just - I'm really happy for my dad.
author: Nicole Richie

text: I'm a dad now and whatever I'm doing in life I usually put a lot of effort into it - usually too much effort, so it kind of comes off ridiculous at times.
author: Jeremy Sisto

text: Some musicians I know are incredible fathers. Like Keith Richards. A fantastic dad.
author: Jack Bruce

text: And, you know, my dad would show me some things sometimes, but the best things that I got to do were to actually see really good players play up close. That gives you an idea of fingering and technique and what not.
author: Dweezil Zappa

text: You know not having my real dad around and having a step dad made me want to be a great dad. So now I have been one for 9 years. And now 3 daughters. So, that is what I am - a dad, first and foremost, before anything else. It's just something that comes natural now.
author: Tim McGraw

text: It wasn't like I was self-motivated. My dad started me. It was his dream before it was mine.
author: Venus Williams

text: It is because my dad died suddenly that I became an actor. I thought, I'm going to make money doing this thing I enjoy.
author: Paul Giamatti

text: My dad takes care of me as a manager and as a dad. That's his job, you know, to take care of me. He has my best interests at heart.
author: Jessica Simpson

text: My first memory of the Rolling Stones is listening to 'Satisfaction' at a sixth-grade slumber party at a friend's house in Ankara, Turkey, where my family was living at the time. In the middle of our sleepover, my friend's dad stopped the record when he heard the words 'girlie action!'
author: Gayle King

text: My mother always taught me, even my dad, just never let other people's opinions of you shape your opinion of yourself. And I never have and I never will.
author: Ruben Studdard

text: One day my dad would say, 'OK, if you want to play tennis I can help you out.' And that's how it started. And I had a goal. I wanted to beat my mom first. And my parents and my brother. And that was the ultimate goal.
author: Caroline Wozniacki

text: A large part of my life revolves around my dad. Sometimes, I even feel a strong sense of connection, something very tangible when I learn something new in the martial arts.
author: Brandon Lee

text: My father never raised his hand to any one of his children, except in self-defense.
author: Fred Allen

text: There was nothing more important I could do than be supportive as a dad.
author: Arne Duncan

text: When I was a kid, my step dad started this business and would go out and get lost cows and stuff. He was part-time truck driver, farmer and cowboy. He taught me how to ride from an early age.
author: Tim McGraw

text: I didn't really get into golf until I was about 14. My mom and dad were taking lessons from a pro an hour and a half from our farm in Cohuna, Australia. When they got home, I'd ask my mom to explain everything they learned - drills and all.
author: Stuart Appleby

text: As Daddy said, life is 95 percent anticipation.
author: Gloria Swanson

text: My dad is a nurse midwife, one of about only 50 male midwives in the U.S., I think.
author: Matthew Morrison

text: There are absolutely no problems between me, my dad and my sister. Obviously I grew up with just my mum, but my relationship with my dad is just fine.
author: Norah Jones

text: I think my dad is a lot cooler than other dads. He still acts like he's still 17.
author: Miley Cyrus

text: My dad and mom believed that you do what you have to do in private and don't make a big deal out of it. Just try to help people as much as you can.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: My dad was great. He was very droll, very dry.
author: Albert Finney

text: Anyone can be a father, but it takes someone special to be a dad, and that's why I call you dad, because you are so special to me. You taught me the game and you taught me how to play it right.
author: Wade Boggs

text: My dad was an entrepreneurial businessman, and maybe I got some of his ability.
author: Thomas Jane

text: I'd love to be a dad. I hope I'd be great at it. That's every man's fear, yet his most important job.
author: Matt Damon

text: You do need parental guidance and I was in a great position with both my mum and dad. They split when I was a baby but even though I stayed with my mom they were both very much involved in my upbringing.
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

text: Music was always the distraction, so it was the obvious choice to pursue. My dad always said to find a job I love to do, that way it wouldn't feel like a job. So I did that.
author: Jason Mraz

text: I'm a dad and that's pretty important.
author: Todd Akin

text: My mom grew up in Kansas, my dad in Indiana. They had boring childhoods.
author: Hunter Parrish

text: I wanted to be a skinny little ballerina but I was a voluptuous little Italian girl whose dad had meatballs on the table every night.
author: Lady Gaga

text: I didn't know my dad for a long time. My dad was on drugs and my dad was at the VA Hospital, my dad was off in his own world selling drugs or using them or there would be crack heads in the house or whatever it would be.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: I asked my daughter when she was 16, What's the buzz on the street with the kids? She's going, to be honest, Dad, most of my friends aren't into Kiss. But they've all been told that it's the greatest show on Earth.
author: Ace Frehley

text: My dad was a militant atheist, or is a militant atheist. My mum was sort of bought up in a religious family because she was a Protestant from Ireland but wasn't especially religious.
author: Tony Blair

text: I wanted my children to have the same exposure to the water I had. My strongest memories of Northeast Harbor are going in a small Whaler with my dad, looking for osprey.
author: Parker Stevenson

text: Every parent is at some time the father of the unreturned prodigal, with nothing to do but keep his house open to hope.
author: John Ciardi

text: I liked a lot of the things other people liked - Jimi Hendrix, The Beatles, Van Halen, AC/DC - but if I compared it to my dad's music, there just seemed to be elements missing.
author: Dweezil Zappa

text: My dad's half-Lebanese, my mom is full Lebanese. I'm three-quarters Lebanese. Irish-Lebanese.
author: Tom Shadyac

text: Now I meditate twice a day for half an hour. In meditation, I can let go of everything. I'm not Hugh Jackman. I'm not a dad. I'm not a husband. I'm just dipping into that powerful source that creates everything. I take a little bath in it.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: My dad is a motorcycle guy, not some Hollywood dude.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: I know my dad is a big Internet freak, and he's been known to be a Wikileaker.
author: Anthony Kiedis

text: The founder of the Mona Foundation actually knew my dad for years, and the more I learned about it, the more I realized I really found the perfect charity. It sponsors schools and educational initiatives all over the planet.
author: Rainn Wilson

text: I never really saw my dad around when the Iron Maiden and the AC/DC were playing. But he knew what I was doing. I was just absorbing music. So he just kind of left me to my own devices.
author: Dhani Harrison

text: My kids are not that interested in my movie career, by the way. My son, in particular, never talks about it. He just wants me as his dad.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: Paul McCartney had a baby when he was 61 Rod Stewart was 66 Rupert Murdoch was a stunning 72. Not only does that mean they'll have less stamina than the average dad, that means they'll, well, check out a lot sooner too.
author: Jeffrey Kluger

text: My mother taught public school, went to Harvard and then got her master's there and taught fifth and sixth grade in a public school. My dad had a more working-class lifestyle. He didn't go to college. He was an auto mechanic and a bartender and a janitor at Harvard.
author: Ben Affleck

text: The problem with me, as far as getting married and having a family, is that my comedy is so important to me. So I don't know if I'll ever be as good a dad as my dad.
author: Adam Sandler

text: My dad was a big believer in treating people well, oftentimes even when he himself wasn't well.
author: Neil Cavuto

text: I was who I was in high school in accordance with the rules of conduct for a normal person, like obeying your mom and dad. Then I got out of high school and moved out of the house, and I just started, for lack of a better term, running free.
author: Iggy Pop

text: No man is responsible for his father. That was entirely his mother's affair.
author: Margaret Turnbull

text: My dad got me a huge board when I was little. He loves to surf. He suited me up and sent me out on this huge wave. I went under, and when I came out and the board hit me in the face. So I said, I never wanted to do this again. I stayed away until I was 13.
author: Shaun White

text: My dad was a Methodist minister.
author: George McGovern

text: I sort of always had an inkling towards some kind of an art form. I grew up in a very small town, and I just figure-skated. My dad played hockey and I was surrounded by sports, but it wasn't quite doing it for me. I wasn't totally fulfilled, and I did a lot of skating.
author: Rachel McAdams

text: The most important influence in my childhood was my father.
author: DeForest Kelley

text: The one thing that kept our family together was the music. The only thing that our family would share emotionally was to have our dad cry over something the kids did with music.
author: Dennis Wilson

text: My dad? He died when I was 19, which is a bad time for your dad to die, because there's an awful lot of things you have to resolve with your parents past your teens if you've been a difficult teenager.
author: Robbie Coltrane

text: My dad taught me to be a leader or a follower, and he said follower ain't fun. So I want to be the leader of Bubba Watson.
author: Bubba Watson

text: My dad has a really great record collection that basically went up to the year I was born: 1984.
author: Ezra Koenig

text: When my dad died a lot of songs came, and they're still coming.
author: Rosanne Cash

text: When my dad toured in '91, I think my first gig properly was the Tokyo Dome, 50,000 people indoors. That was pretty scary. I was 12, or 13.
author: Dhani Harrison

text: I had bohemian parents in Seattle in the last '60s living in a houseboat. My dad wrote science fiction novels and painted big murals and oil paintings.
author: Rainn Wilson

text: I realised I could run after finding out that my dad used to run and it gave me the morale that if he did it then maybe I could also run.
author: David Rudisha

text: An angry father is most cruel towards himself.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: My grandfather had two boys, my uncle had three boys, my dad had me and my two brothers, each of my brothers have had two boys. Then something happened with the chromosomal experiment and suddenly I've got three girls.
author: Greg Kinnear

text: My dad is still Christian Scientist. My mom's not, and I'm not. But I believe in God, and that there's a higher power and an intelligence that's bigger than us and that we can rely on. It's not just us, thinking we are the ones in control of everything. That idea gives me support.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: I think there's nothing better than laughing in life, so that's nice, to be thought of as someone who can make someone laugh. It's 'cause I think life is hard. You know, my dad was a really silly man. A great Irish silly man. And that's fine.
author: Joan Cusack

text: My dad was a baggage handler at Heathrow and careful with money. He worked hard and had three jobs when I was young. I wish I'd inherited his care for money. Sadly, I've grown up to be rather scatty when it comes to finances.
author: Gary Numan

text: The golden child may be the oldest one, unless it's the youngest. It may be the toughest one, unless it's the most sensitive. It's not even necessary that Mom and Dad have the same favorite - and typically they don't.
author: Jeffrey Kluger

text: My dad loves what I do and I support my parents financially because they didn't have a job that gave them a pension.
author: Marilyn Manson

text: One afternoon when I was 9, my dad told me I'd be skipping school the next day. Then we drove 12 hours from Melbourne to Sydney for the Centenary Test, a once-in-a-lifetime commemorative cricket match. It was great fun - especially for a kid who was a massive sports fan.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: I grew up in Greenwich Village. Dad was friends with John Lennon and Yoko Ono.
author: Yancy Butler

text: It's an ongoing joy being a dad.
author: Liam Neeson

text: A dramatic thing, the first time you stand up to your dad.
author: Lenny Kravitz

text: Whenever I fail as a father or husband... a toy and a diamond always works.
author: Shahrukh Khan

text: Everybody always wants to rebel against their parents' music, but nobody listened to music louder than my dad.
author: Dan Auerbach

text: My father, he was like the rock, the guy you went to with every problem.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

text: So much of my aesthetic was formed by my dad.
author: Ron Perlman

text: My dad told me that no one could ever make it as a writer, that my chances were equivalent to winning the lottery - which was good for me, because I like to have something to prove.
author: Poppy Z. Brite

text: But I honestly don't read critics. My dad reads absolutely everything ever written about me. He calls me up to read ecstatic reviews, but I always insist that I can't hear them. If you give value to the good reviews, you have to give value to the criticism.
author: Fiona Apple

text: The place of the father in the modern suburban family is a very small one, particularly if he plays golf.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: I haven't really decided to be an actor yet! I started doing plays when I was about 15 or 16. I only did it because my dad saw a bunch of pretty girls in a restaurant and he asked them where they came from and they said drama group. He said, 'Son, that is where you need to go.'
author: Robert Pattinson

text: Now my dad is with me, traveling with me and a big part of this whole thing is I like to mix it up a little bit, you know. Who gets to take their father on a private jet across the country and stay in first class hotels? So we're enjoying it, but I'd stop if it's not possible.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: Our last jam session was this past Christmas. Dad played his harmonica, mom sang in English and Italian, and I played guitar. I'm so happy that we could share that musical experience for one last time.
author: Tony Visconti

text: I have found having my dad as my North Star has worked well for me.
author: Tony Parsons

text: From about eight years old I was always making things on the sewing machine. Friends would see me making dresses and costumes, and I'd use difficult fabrics such as Lycra and elastic. But you know, my dad was creative and my brother is inventive too.
author: Melissa George

text: I think people like to think I'm in some way financially dependent on my family - on my dad - but the fact of the matter is I've been emancipated from my father since I was 14 years old. That's something people don't know or understand.
author: Devon Aoki

text: My dad calls me 'Mac' a lot, from 'Mike Tyson's Punch Out' - Little Mac is the main character. I was obsessed. I can still beat Mike Tyson on 'Punch Out.'
author: Mayer Hawthorne

text: I deal with my sons like young men. If they have a problem with something, they come to me. I am the type of dad that will drop everything I am doing for them, and always tell them to talk to me about it.
author: Tracy Morgan

text: My dad was in the army. World War II. He got his college education from the army. After World War II he became an insurance salesman. Really, I didn't know my dad very well. He and my mother split up after the war. I was raised by my maternal grandmother and grandfather, and by my mother.
author: Al Pacino

text: I'm afraid that this is me getting on my high horse now but we have yob television, yob newspapers, and funny enough whereas it was my mum and dad, school, police, church who used to set the standards, now it's tabloids and yob television who set the standards by which people live.
author: Gordon Strachan

text: That's a tough question I've been acting since I was 10. My dad was an entrepreneur, so I guess something along those lines. I wouldn't want a 9-5 job.
author: Will Estes

text: Dad was the only adult male I ever trusted.
author: Michael Reagan

text: I can talk to my dad like he's my manager, and put 'Dad' on the back burner. We've been doing it since I was 13.
author: Jessica Simpson

text: My dad is a very quick-witted, sarcastic, dry, humorous guy, whereas my mom's very silly, and that side of the family is very musical.
author: Tim Heidecker

text: Dad taught us about morals, values and goals. Having a tight-knit family was important to him.
author: Junior Seau

text: My dad named me Dakota and my mom came up with my first name Hannah. So it's Hannah Dakota Fanning.
author: Dakota Fanning

text: I absolutely love working with my dad because there is such an ease about it, and I also love his company.
author: Samuel West

text: I love my daughter, but she had me on couscous and fixed me pastas and made me eat oatmeal every morning and what else, turkey burgers, turkey bacon, and that kind of stuff. So she wants her dad to live a long time, and I do, too.
author: Dusty Baker

text: My father loved people, children and pets.
author: Tony Visconti

text: Mom and Dad would stay in bed on Sunday morning, but the kids would have to go to church.
author: Lynn Johnston

text: There's a lot of research behind the scenes that you don't get to see, but I have an instinct that my dad nurtured from when I was born. I was very lucky then.
author: Steve Irwin

text: My Dad hated his job. He sold overcoats, but he wanted to make movies. He had a failed career working with the Ritz Brothers - they were like the Marx Brothers, only a tier below. I always had a picture in my mind of him in a straw hat.
author: Steve Sabol

text: My dad says I could sing before I could talk, if that's possible. I was always humming and things like that.
author: Miley Cyrus

text: From 1965 to 1967, my dad, Jack Gilligan, served in Congress and helped pass landmark laws like the Voting Rights Act.
author: Kathleen Sebelius

text: My dad is a marketing mastermind.
author: Serena Williams

text: My dad's a doctor, and when I was 8, I went to one of his medical conferences where they were demonstrating laser surgery on a chicken. I was so mad that a chicken had to die, I never ate meat again.
author: Natalie Portman

text: I'll back up anything my dad says.
author: Floyd Mayweather, Jr.

text: You have to respect your parents. They are giving you an at-bat. If you're an entrepreneur and go into the family business, you want to grow fast. Patience is important. But respect the other party... My dad and I pulled it off because we really respect each other.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

text: My dad died when I was three so my mom had to raise four kids on her own, and I think there's a part of me that pulls upon having watched my mom do that our whole lives. She had to make it work.
author: Leslie Bibb

text: My dad would always say, 'What can you do to make the world a better place?' Well, I can make people laugh.
author: Jon Lovitz

text: I grew up watching Monday Night Football with Howard Cosell and the other guys with my dad.
author: Lisa Guerrero

text: My dad was a musician. He was a singer and he played the guitar, so music was always around.
author: Kris Allen

text: I shouldn't have got married. My dad told me. I was 35 and I got married. He said, 'You're too young to be married'. 'What? I'm 35'. Said, 'You're far too young. You haven't lived yet'. He was right, bless him, thanks, Dad.
author: Rod Stewart

text: I have great faith that Heaven's there and I'll see my brothers and my mom and dad when I get there.
author: Ernie Harwell

text: I had the best of both worlds when I was a kid. I'd spend a quiet week with my mum, then I'd go to my dad's property in the Adelaide Hills, where there were all these kids and animals running around.
author: Teresa Palmer

text: My dad was a huge country music fan, but he also had a band and he sang. So he'd listen to a lot of music and the songs that he'd learn for the band were more from the male artists. So my earliest country memories were Waylon Jennings, Conway Twitty, George Jones, Johnny Paycheck even.
author: Martina McBride

text: I'm looking out for myself, but I'm looking out for my dad, too.
author: Jamie Redknapp

text: As a father now, I wouldn't do what my dad did, because it left me feeling emotionally unstable as a kid. But he didn't do the things he did out of selfishness or malice.
author: Anthony Kiedis

text: My dad wanted me to play when I was a kid, so I learned to play the guitar. I pursued a career in music because I love it so much and I enjoy what it does to those who hear it.
author: Randy Travis

text: I think it's easiest to teach by example. My dad didn't tell us to work hard we just saw how hard he worked. I know I have shortcomings - like a short fuse - but I've learned you can't come home from a long day of work and snap at the kids.
author: Chris O'Donnell

text: My father wants me to be like my brother, but I can't be.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

text: I was punished for blowing the whistle on my father's lifestyle.
author: Tatum O'Neal

text: My dad's probably one of the kindest people in the world. When I was younger that's not how I was- I was a little spoiled brat.
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

text: Dad taught me everything I know. Unfortunately, he didn't teach me everything he knows.
author: Al Unser

text: Dad, wherever you are, you are gone but you will never be forgotten.
author: Conrad Hall

text: I had lost relationships with my dad, my brother and sister and I was just like, you know what, this is definitely the time to just get it together and so that's what I did.
author: Nicole Richie

text: When I found out I got this job, I cried, of course - I'm a girly-girl - and then I called my dad, and he cried, too. On so many levels, this is a thrill for me.
author: Lisa Guerrero

text: My dad and I played music. He teaches me a song or two every time I'm home.
author: Levon Helm

text: There is nothing that would upset me more than my dad being bribed by the press. It's like, 'Just let them run it, then. Don't you give them ammunition.'
author: Adele

text: My dad was a homicide cop in the gay neighborhood in the city when gay neighborhoods were desperate, depressing, sad places run by the mob. The only gay people he'd met when I came out to him were corpses.
author: Dan Savage

text: My mom and dad just loved the fact that I fooled around. They just embraced it. They'd always kind of enjoy it, and they liked it when I made them laugh.
author: Dominic Monaghan

text: My dad came from Cuba when he was a teenager not speaking English. And I grew up here speaking Spanglish. That's the world in which I grew up, and that's a world in which a lot of second generation immigrants find themselves.
author: Ted Cruz

text: My dad's an architect and my mom owned a French bakery for twelve years.
author: Alison Lohman

text: David and Dad didn't get along too well growing up. I mean we all got along, but it was harder on David, because David wasn't going to be the son that Dad wanted. But now they're like best friends.
author: Amy Sedaris

text: I forgive my mom for being a psycho and my dad for being a loser.
author: Nikki Sixx

text: I think women look for that quality in a man of being a good dad whether they're immediately wanting to be a parent or not.
author: Emily VanCamp

text: Because of my father, we are that Shining City on a Hill.
author: Michael Reagan

text: I think my dad is the only Arabic descendent who is an unsuccessful businessman.
author: Shakira

text: I never had a speech from my father 'this is what you must do or shouldn't do' but I just learned to be led by example. My father wasn't perfect.
author: Adam Sandler

text: When I started writing, I did have some idealised notion of my dad as a writer. But I have less and less of a literary rivalry with him as I've gone on. I certainly don't feel I need his approval, although maybe that's because I'm confident that I've got it.
author: Paul Theroux

text: Parents don't understand kids and kids don't understand parents. My parents were divorced when I was really young and I went to live with my dad.
author: Mark Hoppus

text: My father was so good-natured and had such a happy disposition. I've always confused him with Jimmy Stewart. So, think Jimmy Stewart. That's my dad.
author: Jane Pauley

text: I've got high standards when it comes to boys. As my dad says, all girls should! I'm from the South - Tennessee, to be exact - and down there, we're all about southern hospitality. I know that if I like a guy, he better be nice, and above all, my dad has to approve of him!
author: Miley Cyrus

text: The music I want to hear in my head sounds somewhere between Jimi Hendrix and Massive Attack. It's not really like my dad, but there will always be similarities because we have the same vocal cords, and I learnt the guitar the way he taught me.
author: Dhani Harrison

text: Truthfully, I'm still Corey Hart, Dad, first.
author: Corey Hart

text: My father invented a cure for which there was no disease and unfortunately my mother caught it and died of it.
author: Victor Borge

text: My dad took me to my first movie.
author: Steven Spielberg

text: I always had a standard of, back when I was doing the country music I always told people I would never record a song that I wouldn't sit down and sing in front of my mom and dad.
author: Ricky Skaggs

text: Sons have always a rebellious wish to be disillusioned by that which charmed their fathers.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: I am an obsessive garage cleaner - my wife and the neighbors make fun of me. I remember that my father was the same way, and now when I'm out there unearthing things in the garage, I realize I am becoming my dad!
author: Chris O'Donnell

text: If you had told me at 45 years old that I would have to go on tour to get rest, I would've said, 'That's not how it works.' But nothing can be more gratifying. I'm a very hands-on dad.
author: Chris Robinson

text: When I was about 12 and first started wearing lipstick, my dad would ask, 'Are you wearing makeup?' I would say back, 'You're wearing more makeup there than I am!'
author: Georgia Jagger

text: One of my earliest memories is of my father carrying me in one arm with a picket sign in the other.
author: Camryn Manheim

text: When I grew up, people said, 'You'll never be the man your dad was.' And I said, 'Gee, I hope not.'
author: Rip Torn

text: My dad bought me a guitar and people would ask me to play.
author: Rod Stewart

text: We came from a family where we ran our own small business. Our dad made his own products. We made our own sausages, our own meatloafs, our own pickles. Dad had to do everything himself. He had to figure out how to finance his business.
author: Marcy Kaptur

text: I watched Italia '90 with my Mum and Dad and my brother, you know, leaping around the house when the penalties were on... It would be great to be part of that, to have that kind of impact.
author: Steven Gerrard

text: A father and two sons run Adelphia. It's a cable company. And they took from that company a billion dollars. A billion. Three people - three people took a billion dollars. What were they gonna do, start their own space program? 'Let's send the monkey to Mars, Dad!'
author: Lewis Black

text: I was just a kid and I didn't have a dad. That's hard, because when you're a kid, you blame yourself for everything. And I blamed myself for him not being around, for my parents not being together.
author: Jonathan Rhys Meyers

text: I had the opportunity to go to law school, and my dad, who was an accountant, couldn't believe I wanted to walk away from that and start cooking.
author: Curtis Stone

text: My dad was a golden gloves boxer in the Marine Corps, then a deputy sheriff. My mom worked as an office assistant.
author: Susana Martinez

text: I have one brother, John, an airline pilot, who is seven years younger. He's adopted, though we're still blood related - he's my cousin. My parents couldn't have any more children after me, so when Dad's brother died, they adopted John, then just a baby.
author: Gary Numan

text: I was always a kid trying to make a buck. I borrowed a dollar from my dad, went to the penny candy store, bought a dollar's worth of candy, set up my booth, and sold candy for five cents apiece. Ate half my inventory, made $2.50, gave my dad back his dollar.
author: Guy Fieri

text: You always hear people saying, 'I hope I'm not turning into my dad', but I'd be honoured if I became half as decent a bloke as he is.
author: Johnny Vegas

text: My dad, bless him, was a musician. And his dad had thought that his music was rubbish.
author: Paul McCartney

text: I had to learn how to chop wood actually - I don't think my dad would have let me go chop wood in the backyard growing up.
author: Jennifer Lawrence

text: I lost my mother, who suffered from Alzheimer's disease, and we had to relocate my dad after 58 years in the family home. That was tough.
author: Doug Davidson

text: The moment my doctor told me, I went silent. My mum and dad were with me, then we all went to pieces. I was saying, No, I've got my flight to Sydney in two hours. I'm getting on a plane.
author: Kylie Minogue

text: After graduating from flares and platforms in the early 1970s, I started drama school wearing a pair of khaki dungarees with one of my Dad's Army shirts, accessorised by a cat's basket doubling as a handbag. Very Lady Gaga.
author: Jenny Eclair

text: Many forms, sizes and colors, I think there are heroes in sports, in life... It would be cliche to say my dad, my granddad. I think I'm a fan of people who were brave, my aunt, my grandmother, those are my heroes.
author: George Eads

text: My dad, he's the rocker.
author: Shaun White

text: My dad is a huge rock and roll lead guitar fan. I didn't even really know that until recently. Everything has to have a guitar solo in it.
author: Slash

text: I miss my Dad. My Dad loved cheesy monster movies, so we'd have Godzilla movie marathons. Those are some of my favorite memories, laughing at how the monster outfits were so bad, like black garbage bags for heads.
author: Ahmet Zappa

text: My father wouldn't get us a TV, he wouldn't allow a TV in the house.
author: Janis Joplin

text: Tiffany is very proud to have the last name and she's proud of her dad.
author: Marla Maples

text: I love my mom and dad.
author: Taylor Momsen

text: You know, my mother's beautiful, my dad was a really handsome man, and there was a lot of talk about looks when I was growing up.
author: Courteney Cox

text: Being a father to my family and a husband is to me much more important than what I did in the business.
author: Tom Bosley

text: And I saw the sax line-up that he had behind him and I thought, I'm going to learn the saxophone. When I grow up, I'm going to play in his band. So I sort of persuaded my dad to get me a kind of a plastic saxophone on the hire purchase plan.
author: David Bowie

text: I would ask my dad what he did, and he'd say, 'I listen to people's problems.' In some way what he did for a living is in my genes.
author: Marcia Cross

text: I didn't want to play a lawyer. I didn't want to play a doctor. I didn't want to play a single dad. I wanted to do something I felt I could learn from, something that would be a challenge and something that would not dry up.
author: William Petersen

text: During the Depression, my dad made radios to sell to make extra money. Nobody had any money to buy the radios, so he would trade them for dogs. He built kennels in the backyard, and he cared for the dogs.
author: Betty White

text: But my father was also the one who told me I needed to clean up my mouth or I'd never find a man. What's very important to him is manners. Show up on time. Always send thank-you letters. He is one of the more thoughtful humans I've ever met. He's a great man and a very good dad.
author: Zosia Mamet

text: If anybody had a reason to become a delinquent, to become a criminal, to be angry at the man, to be angry at the white man, to be angry at America, it's my dad, but he did not feel that way at all.
author: Larry Elder

text: You know my dad pushed me to believe that I was going to be the best. I just never thought of life without tennis, even looking forward.
author: Andre Agassi

text: I could not tell you the date of my mother's death. I could not tell you the date of my dad's death. These are not dates that I find significant.
author: O. J. Simpson

text: My dad was diagnosed with cancer, so we ended up burying him a year to the day that he was diagnosed.
author: Seann William Scott

text: Humor is always based on a modicum of truth. Have you ever heard a joke about a father-in-law?
author: Dick Clark

text: My dad was the district attorney of New Orleans for about 30 years. And when he opened his campaign headquarters back in the early '70s, when I was 5 years old, my mother wanted me to play the national anthem. And they got an upright piano on the back of a flatbed truck and I played it.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: And I remember leaving my place in L.A. and - my father is a big fight fan - and I said, 'Dad, I got a couple of days off and I'm getting ready to go to Houston to sign to fight Muhammad Ali.
author: Wilt Chamberlain

text: Dad worked in a warehouse when I was little and I didn't see him for three years as he was doing all the overtime God gave him to buy me new ballet shoes, or a new tutu.
author: Jennifer Ellison

text: When I was younger, my family would go camping and fishing on our ranches. My dad loves being around all kinds of animals. He's the one who got me to be a really big animal lover.
author: Paris Hilton

text: I love being a dad. I just love it.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: My dad remembers being in school with my uncle, and the teacher would say outright to the class that the Japanese were second-class citizens and shouldn't be trusted.
author: Mike Shinoda

text: I wanted to travel with my dad to be close to him again. Having babies and raising my own family took so much of my time, I didn't have a chance to be with him very often.
author: Nancy Sinatra

text: My dad has always been really helpful. He taught me that talent is a bonus, but persistence is what wins out.
author: Zosia Mamet

text: I once said to my father, when I was a boy, 'Dad we need a third political party.' He said to me, 'I'll settle for a second.'
author: Ralph Nader

text: My dad used to say, 'You have to become part of the machine to beat the machine,' and there's some validity in it. But honestly, even when I'm inside the machine, you still see me. I stick out a little bit.
author: Michael Shannon

text: I inherited that calm from my father, who was a farmer. You sow, you wait for good or bad weather, you harvest, but working is something you always need to do.
author: Miguel Indurain

text: Every family is different. I am mom and I am dad and I'm going to do my best. You should be proud, walk through life saying I have the coolest family. I am part of a modern family.
author: Ricky Martin

text: My Dad is my hero. He's 85 now and he is in great health. He is handsome and strong. He has an incredible moral and ethical backbone. I couldn't have been luckier with my parents.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: My dad was an engineer, and he became the CEO of Chevron. His was an engineer's mind-set: Everything's kind of a problem how do you approach the problem?
author: Bill Keller

text: Becoming a dad means you have to be a role model for your son and be someone he can look up to.
author: Wayne Rooney

text: I recruited my dad to be my bass player and fired him on several occasions. He stayed on as a bus driver.
author: Chely Wright

text: You know, no matter what I am or what I do for a living, I'm still, you know, the husband and the dad and the protector of the house, and I have to be conscientious about that.
author: Richie Sambora

text: Also, to be honest, my dad wanted me to be an athlete. And I think all sons want to prove something to their dad. So now, aged 35, I want to see what I can achieve physically.
author: Joe Manganiello

text: People who build family businesses are not classically trained. They have to deal with an enormous amount of politics. You think corporate politics are tough? Go work for your dad or your mom.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

text: I haven't been baptised. My dad's not in the church and is not a religious person. My mum is more spiritual - she does Thai-chi and goes to Stonehenge and things like that. I'm proud to be pagan. Finland is not really a religious country. I'm still looking for my god.
author: Ville Valo

text: My dad was a musician and I traveled around with him, so it was something that I knew.
author: Taryn Manning

text: My dad had a personal style which was very attractive. It was quite reserved and quite elegant, and it was infectious.
author: Bill Nighy

text: In fact, I had the idea because of Peter Falk. I saw my dad watching a Peter Falk movie and something clicked in my head. I gotta go make a movie for Peter Falk and me.
author: Paul Reiser

text: My dad was a bartender. My mom was a cashier, a maid and a stock clerk at K-Mart. They never made it big. They were never rich. And yet they were successful. Because just a few decades removed from hopelessness, they made possible for us all the things that had been impossible for them.
author: Marco Rubio

text: My father... had sharper eyes than the rest of our people.
author: Chief Joseph

text: My dad always used to tell me that if they challenge you to an after-school fight, tell them you won't wait-you can kick their ass right now.
author: Cameron Diaz

text: My dad loved to laugh. He was very funny and very silly.
author: Mike Myers

text: My dad served in the Air Force as ground crew for several years, and doesn't really talk about it. I know that it's there. I think my main thing about direct or indirect experiences as near to home as it were is the idea of self-sacrifice really.
author: Jeremy Northam

text: I had a dad you know.
author: Darrell Hammond

text: My father taught me how to substitute realities.
author: Mira Sorvino

text: My dad had this rock hard body and would work 12- to 13-hour days. The guys he worked with were scrap-iron guys. Nobody on that road crew had read a book in 10 years, but there was something about the way they lived I really admired.
author: Richard Russo

text: I'm one of five kids and we lived on a massive farm in New South Wales with my mum and dad.
author: Abbie Cornish

text: I can't remember a major league game where I could make eye contact with my dad. I kept wondering if he was going to yell at me for hanging a pitch or something.
author: David Cone

text: I probably have an earlier curfew than anyone. My mom wants to keep me really safe and my dad's not overly protective, but he's a dad no matter what.
author: Miley Cyrus

text: My dad let me figure out what I wanted to do on my own.
author: Georgia Jagger

text: My father was not a failure. After all, he was the father of a president of the United States.
author: Harry S. Truman

text: My dad was a sports writer when I was younger and then he became just a general columnist. But I grew up with him literally getting into brawls with football coaches.
author: Amy Klobuchar

text: My dad's passion was to teach adults to read so they could read to their kids.
author: Jennie Garth

text: I think a dad has to make his daughter feel that he's genuinely interested in what she's going through.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: And then before going back for my sophomore year, I decided to change my major to arts and sciences, and my dad cut a deal with me: He said if I'd quit school he'd pay my rent for the next three years, as if I were in school.
author: Sarah Silverman

text: I didn't have any role models really. My best friend was a dog. My mum and dad saved a dog from the gutter and that dog was my brother before Jesse was born. Sami was his name and he was my role model.
author: Ville Valo

text: My dad served in two wars has been flying airplanes for 60 years now. He was certainly quite an inspiration.
author: John L. Phillips

text: As much as I transferred my mother to Elizabeth Shore of The Black Dahlia, as much as her dad mutated into an obsession with crime in general, well, I have thought about other things throughout the years.
author: James Ellroy

text: At one point my dad called me and said, 'You have always been a great salesman. I think it's time you come home and sell swimming pools.'
author: Courteney Cox

text: A father's disappointment can be a very powerful tool.
author: Michael Bergin

text: I used to say, 'Man, I think I'd be a really good dad. I'll be a great provider. I'm funny I'll go on trips with them - I'll do all sorts of stuff.' But the momming? I'm not made for that. I have a really good mom I know what she put into it.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: No, I never thought about my father's money as my money.
author: Christie Hefner

text: I actually study boxing - my dad was a Golden Gloves champion so I learned how to fight at a very young age. Growing up in Brooklyn you always had to watch your back, so I pretty much learned to protect myself.
author: Lana Parrilla

text: A spirit is, like, your mother, my dad, who've made it. They can come around, but they come around in a loving way because they've already made it to God. Most people make it.
author: Sylvia Browne

text: My mum and my dad are the sweetest couple.
author: Rita Ora

text: My mum and dad had worked incredibly hard to afford me an education.
author: Benedict Cumberbatch

text: I wanted to make a point of basing myself at home, being close to my family. I'll never be able to repay Mum and Dad for what they did, but at least they know they'll never have to work another day. I'll do whatever it takes to look after them.
author: Rory McIlroy

text: My parents were both actors my dad sort of quite early on. My mother acted for a while, and now she's a painter.
author: Sam Rockwell

text: When my dad was badly weakened by the flu and my mom wanted to call an ambulance to take him to the emergency room, he wouldn't go unless he could shave first and change into a nice shirt and a pair of slacks.
author: Rich Lowry

text: My parents loved each other. I was raised in a house of total love and respect. My dad worked very hard and my mother was incredibly devoted to him. I can unequivocally, without any peradventure of doubt, tell you that I was raised with the kind of love that we only dream of.
author: James Wood

text: My dad has always been extremely supportive in every decision I've made and much more interested in me picking what I wanted to do.
author: Colin Hanks

text: My mom and dad - they were always there. They were always on the set. They focused on our family life. The entertainment business wasn't the end-all. They weren't out to get the next big paycheck or the next big movie. It was about 'What can we do as a family.'
author: Candace Cameron Bure

text: My dad is very successful in his business. He's always been big in having hobbies and having little ways to get away. He always made time for hunting and fishing. He always encouraged me to do it.
author: Luke Bryan

text: You know when everyone's watching, your mom and dad, your friends in high school who thought they were better than you. You get your chance to get in the spotlight and shine.
author: Shaun Alexander

text: I am not ashamed to say that no man I ever met was my father's equal, and I never loved any other man as much.
author: Hedy Lamarr

text: I grew up not liking my father very much. I never saw him cry. But he must have. Everybody cries.
author: Charley Pride

text: Your kids can say some cruel things to you at times. For example, Nicole, Miles and Sofie are standing there in the room and I'm dressed to kill in my own mind. They'll say to me, 'Dad, you're not going out there looking like that are you?' If that doesn't kill a star, I don't know what does!
author: Lionel Richie

text: I love to cook. My dad's a really excellent cook and his style is: Look in the fridge and make whatever there is with whatever ingredients you have and I like cooking like that, too.
author: Olivia Thirlby

text: My dad has always been my coach. And I've spent so much time with him. So he's one of my best friends. And I can talk to him about everything.
author: Caroline Wozniacki

text: My dad spent his whole life getting into fights for telling what he believed to be the truth. Basically it comes from my dad-and he's screaming right-wing, so there you are.
author: Thom Yorke

text: Rich men's sons are seldom rich men's fathers.
author: Herbert Kaufman

text: When a father, absent during the day, returns home at six, his children receive only his temperament, not his teaching.
author: Robert Bly

text: I always wanted to be a father. I have a beautiful relationship with my dad and beautiful memories. I always knew I was going to have a family.
author: Ricky Martin

text: One of the greatest titles in the world is parent, and one of the biggest blessings in the world is to have parents to call mom and dad.
author: Jim DeMint

text: When you get pure joy out of 'being' rather than 'doing' or 'seeing,' that's when you realize how big and unexplainable some things are and being a dad is one of those very few things.
author: Brendan Fehr

text: I have always had the feeling I could do anything and my dad told me I could. I was in college before I found out he might be wrong.
author: Ann Richards

text: It is a sad commentary of our times when our young must seek advice and counsel from 'Dear Abby' instead of going to Mom and Dad.
author: Abigail Van Buren

text: I just wish I could understand my father.
author: Michael Jackson

text: And my dad drilled it in my head, you know, 'If you want it bad enough, and you're willing to make the sacrifices, you can do it. But first you have to believe in yourself.
author: Jennie Finch

text: My dad had been an actor... not only had my dad been an actor, but his dad had been an actor, and my great-grandfather had been an actor. And who knows before then?
author: David Hyde Pierce

text: My sensei was a British karate champion named Brian Fitkin. He was my mentor and because I had a hard relationship with my dad, he became a father figure to me.
author: Dolph Lundgren

text: Dad kept us out of school, but school comes and goes. Family is forever.
author: Charlie Sheen

text: And what is a stage dad, or a stage mom? It's someone who's protective. That's all.
author: Nigel Lythgoe

text: My folks have played everything from rock, disco, pop, funk, and blues. My dad has always brought and played different genres like jazz, classical, and Latin. With all this in my pocket, I feel I have a taste of everything for my influences.
author: Haley Reinhart

text: My dad, he is such a soft man. Even if he has these opinions about my boyfriends, he will be the sweetest guy. He will make you feel like you're fascinating and awesome, even if he doesn't like you that much.
author: Amanda Seyfried

text: My parents were involved in everything I did. They were showbiz people themselves. My dad was an actor. They were parents they did what parents are supposed to do.
author: Tina Yothers

text: I owe a lot to my dad, just for having provided the wrestling business for us to get into.
author: Owen Hart

text: My family was very supportive of whatever I wanted because my grandfather was an opera singer. My dad's dad. So my dad has an appreciation for the arts, and he let me choose my own path.
author: Tony Hale

text: Losing my parents was the most crushing thing that ever happened to me. I lost my dad when I was 26, and it changed my life entirely.
author: Harlan Coben

text: Going to the theater is such a joyous experience. My dad would take my sister and me to plays when we were very young, like six or seven years old.
author: Julia Roberts

text: Fortunately, as it pertains to guns, my dad and uncle introduced me to guns the way it needs to be done: smart, slow and safe.
author: Ted Nugent

text: We all feel really blessed to have been with my dad for these 85 years.
author: Beau Bridges

text: My dad always told me that the best way to get somebody to get at you is to talk bad about them to somebody else.
author: T-Pain

text: I am blessed to have Mom and Dad.
author: Kevin Eubanks

text: Father told me that if I ever met a lady in a dress like yours, I must look her straight in the eyes.
author: Prince Charles

text: I was lucky to have my dad in my life. As crazy as things got, I always had him to put his hand on my shoulder.
author: Sharon Stone

text: My dad was a particularly polite kind of guy, very courteous.
author: Paul McCartney

text: I finished high school, moved to Nashville for college, and set out to break into the music business. Every night when I called home with news of my experiences, my mom and dad would encourage me to keep taking those small steps.
author: Trisha Yearwood

text: Me and my dad are the biggest promoters of an estate tax in the US. It's not a popular position.
author: Bill Gates

text: My dad had a movie theater so I was there every night.
author: Brion James

text: We always had lutefisk for Christmas dinner, after which Dad read from the Norwegian Bible.
author: Peter Agre

text: In addition, there is one title I cherish a great deal more than Congressman and that is the title of... Dad.
author: J. C. Watts

text: Well my dad was a pretty good player at one stage and my two older brothers played golf as well. So there were always golf clubs flying around the house.
author: Retief Goosen

text: My father and I have a very good relationship. We always got along. But I always scold him.
author: Amy Sedaris

text: Recently, I was in Bernalda, my dad's ancestral home town in Italy. He has just refurbished a palazzo and turned it into a hotel, so we had my sister's wedding there. It was beautiful.
author: Roman Coppola

text: My dad always said I was hard-headed, that it would take something like that to wake me up spiritually, and I guess it did. My heart had gotten so beat up that I didn't have anything left to give.
author: Scott Stapp

text: Well, I am a lot like my dad, and the character of Ted is based on my dad.
author: Max Cannon

text: My dad was a diplomat and after living in America, where I was born, he was posted to Cairo.
author: Arabella Weir

text: When you're shooting a film, you really don't get to be a dad, and you don't really get to be a husband. You don't really exist at all. But I do drag my family with me on location whenever I can.
author: Eric Bana

text: 'Keep your head down at school.' Those are sage words from my dad. They kept me in check for years.
author: Dhani Harrison

text: I also turn down what's probably a good amount of coinage to be made out of playing dads, an incredible number of obnoxious dad.
author: Bill Pullman

text: Thirteen, 13 children, and I love - I love them all. And I think I've been a good father to all of them.
author: Anthony Quinn

text: My father came from a very poor background, but I was very fortunate in the sense that we were never in need. My dad was determined to make sure that we didn't want for things. He wanted to give us more opportunity than he had, a better shot at a better life.
author: Brad Pitt

text: It's a complex relationship when your dad happened to be president and you are president and then you have all the amateur psychology that goes on when people try to speculate about motivations.
author: Jeb Bush

text: We all started snowboarding in the beginning as a family just to be closer together, go on trips. It was our soccer, but instead of Dad yelling at me from the sideline he is there riding with me and hitting the jumps even before I am hitting them.
author: Shaun White

text: I've always taken my love of children from my father. He was a children magnet. Suddenly, having my first child hit home what my dad went through.
author: Robert Carlyle

text: My dad believes in God, I think. I'm not sure if my mom does. I don't.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

text: My dad works in child protection and he's spent many, many years in that line of work.
author: Chris Hemsworth

text: My dad is a huge rock n' roll lead guitar fan.
author: Slash

text: Father or stepfather - those are just titles to me. They don't mean anything.
author: Oliver Hudson

text: My dad's era believed that there was something noble in being a good guy - the kind of guy that lived straight and narrow, told the truth, and stood up for what he believed was right.
author: Dean Norris

text: My dad was a labourer and my mum had exactly the same job as Noel Gallagher's mum - she was a dinner lady at our local school. Everyone comes over from Ireland and they get the same jobs.
author: Danny Boyle

text: My dad was like a stage mother he always pushed me to do what I wanted.
author: Jim Carrey

text: My dad liked a lot of Motown, but I didn't listen to it until my teenage years.
author: John Legend

text: My dad's not a very intimidating father figure.
author: Georgia Jagger

text: I went and took golf lessons so Dad would let me play with him. I was just terrible... but I was able to have a wonderful time just walking around with Dad. I can see the real pleasure of that game.
author: David Hyde Pierce

text: My dad's side of the family had lots of artists and musicians. There's an emotional, quite sentimental quality to Slavic culture. It's very open, it loves art, it loves music, it loves literature. It's very warm, it's very up, it's very down. I would celebrate that.
author: Nick Clegg

text: My first outdoor cooking memories are full of erratic British summers, Dad swearing at a barbecue that he couldn't put together, and eventually eating charred sausages, feeling brilliant.
author: Jamie Oliver

text: I am lucky to have had an attentive, curious and loving dad and heart-smart, down-to-earth, gifted mother. They changed the outlooks of their own lives and have never forgotten the people and organizations that helped them dream bigger than their circumstances should have allowed.
author: Jennifer Garner

text: Well, my dad was the district attorney of New Orleans for about 30 years.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: I was always the new kid in school, I'm the kid from a broken family, I'm the kid who had no dad showing up at the father-son stuff, I'm the kid that was using food stamps at the grocery store.
author: Dave Mustaine

text: I always wanted what Mom and Dad had.
author: Kim Kardashian

text: All the learnin' my father paid for was a bit o' birch at one end and an alphabet at the other.
author: George Eliot

text: Becoming a dad was the proudest moment of my life. Playing football does not even compare.
author: Wayne Rooney

text: I love being a dad. I'd have more kids if I could. I'd take a couple more, one or two more before I croak.
author: Richie Sambora

text: When it came to the stylish and graceful art of ballroom dancing, my dad was a king of the clubs, a prowling tiger and a wonderfully natural mover.
author: Bruno Tonioli

text: My dad taught me from my youngest childhood memories through these connections with Aboriginal and tribal people that you must always protect people's sacred status, regardless of the pest.
author: Steve Irwin

text: Jenna's traveled with me they've both traveled with their dad. This is the only time they've been old enough in all of their dad's campaigns to really be involved in.
author: Laura Bush

text: My mom and dad played this music all the time when I was growing up, so to me songs by Jerry Lee and Fats Domino are the classics, they're the best songs ever.
author: Chris Isaak

text: If my Dad doesn't like you, you will know. My Mom is just too innocent to ever lie. She doesn't even cuss.
author: Channing Tatum
